newsitem.title: USA: Vermont lawmakers disagree over taxes - paper.
newsitem.headline: Vermont lawmakers disagree over taxes - paper.

text.p: NEW YORK, Jan 8 (Reuter) Vermont legislators agreed on the need to relieve property tax burdens by increasing other taxes, but do not agree on how to accomplish that goal, according to a poll by The Burlington Free Press.

The paper, which got responses from 27 of the state's 30 Senators and 138 of the 150 state Representatives, found that nearly two-thirds of the lawmakers support raising some taxes to help pay local costs of education, now funded through local property taxes.
Only about one-third support raising income taxes, an option opposed by Governor Howard Dean.

On other issues, lawmakers are opposed to using public money for private school education, divided over campaign finance reform, and in favor of reforming the state's system of regulating profession, the paper said.
